segments.text: I can’t take my eyes off the woman at the sink, her focus so singular, caught up in drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the boy is climbing higher, his hands reaching for the cookie jar with such zeal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a mix of admiration and anxiety watching him; he’s so daring.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His balancing act on that rickety stool is nerve-wracking, and I can hardly breathe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl next to him looks on with wide eyes, arm extended, as if willing the cookie to jump into her hand.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a moment filled with childish wonder, and yet it feels so dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water continues to flow over the edge without a care, and I’m shocked she hasn’t reacted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The warm sunlight floods the kitchen, illuminating the chaos beneath its glow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think of the mess they’re creating, the water damage, the potential for someone to slip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This ordinary scene has morphed into a tense drama, and all I can do is watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
